meanings.definition: To make a bubbling or gurgling sound.
meanings.sent1: The stream guggled as it flowed over the rocks.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the tea kettle guggle on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The baby found it funny when the bathwater started to guggle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter guggled out of her like a bubbling brook.
meanings.sent5: The soda can guggled when I opened it, releasing the fizz.

meanings.sent1: The gurgle of the water in the fountain was soothing.
meanings.sent2: I heard a strange guggle coming from the drain.
meanings.sent3: The guggle of the coffee maker woke me up in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The gurgle of the stream was like nature's music.
meanings.sent5: The gurgle of the brook was a symphony of nature.
